The mention of a U: K. study from 1998 that claimed to show a link between the MMR vaccine and autism.
The retraction of the U: K. study by the Lancet in 2010.
The impact of the U: K. study on vaccination rates, with a drop from the 90 percent range to 80 percent.
Confirmation from Dr: Mark Schleiss, director of Pediatric Infectious Diseases at the University of Minnesota Medical School, that the science was clear in 2010 and remains clear today.
